title: English Speaking Improvement Course for Science Practitioners Based on TBLT: Focus on Experimentation, Presentation, and Collaboration Scenarios

context.prior_knowledge: Intermediate English communication skills, basic practical experience in scientific fields, and foundational understanding of experimental design, data analysis, and variable control
context.additional_context: Aims to improve English speaking skills for science professionals in workplace contexts, applying Task-Based Language Teaching (TBLT) for practical, scenario-based training reflecting the scientific inquiry process (hypothesis→experiment→analysis→conclusion). Integrates scientific methodologies (observation, measurement, analysis, evidence collection) with language learning

learning_goals: Improvement in the ability to deliver 5+ minute English presentations required in practical contexts, including science experiment results, research data analysis, and evidence-based conclusions.

Learners can engage in 10+ minute English discussions with peer practitioners on complex research topics (variable control, hypothesis testing, scientific inquiry processes), accurately use ≥ 5 specialized terms during discussions, and propose revised solutions incorporating ≥ 2 of 3 peer feedback items.

Learners demonstrate natural English communication with ≥ 80% accuracy in 10 role-plays based on science experiments/research scenarios reflecting corporate work environments (e.g., meetings, negotiations, presentations). Each scenario must meet ≥ 2 of 4 rubric criteria: pronunciation, fluency, scientific accuracy, data analysis skills.

resources: English Language Textbooks for Science Subjects

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
